channel.title: Release Notes Conference
channel.description:
I know we have more than a few Bootstrapped.fm listeners who are also fans of the Release Notes podcast. As you may know, Charles and Joe are organizing a conference focusing on building a business around iOS and Mac apps. If anyone is interested, you can find more info on the conference [here][1].
I believe Charles and Joe are both on this forum, so if anyone has any questions about the conference, please use this thread.
[1]: http://releasenotes.tv/conference

item.title: Release Notes Conference
item.dc:creator: DazeEnd
item.description:
Thanks to Andrey and Ian for saying such nice things about Release Notes on the most recent episode of Bootstrapped. If anyone out there is interested in attending a conference about the business of iOS and Mac development, you can buy your ticket on our website (http://releasenotes.tv/conference). Use coupon code BOOTSTRAPPED to get $100 off your ticket price.

We hope to see you there!

Read full topic

http://releasenotes.tv/conference

Useful details:

Date: October 21-23, 2015
Location: Indianapolis, IN

Read full topic

item.title: Release Notes Conference
item.dc:creator: DazeEnd
item.description:
Thanks Andrey. I’ve been a long-time listener to Bootstrapped (and a lurker on these forums), so I really appreciate the introduction.

As Andrey mentioned, I’m helping organize Release Notes, which is a conference about the business of iOS and Mac development. There’s a lot of overlap between that topic and other fields like the business of Android, SaaS, and .Net development, though, so we hope and expect to have some “cross-pollination” with indies and bootstrappers from other disciplines represented. We also recognize that a lot of the business of the software business is done as consulting, so we’ll have talks and discussions about not just product work, but also independent contractors.

We’d love to have a contingent of Bootstrapped.fm listeners at Release Notes, so please let me know if you have any questions. Tickets are available on our website (http://releasenotes.tv/conference), but sales will be ending on Oct 12th. We hope to see you there!

Read full topic
